Direct power off

Power off your projector immediately or directly at the mains. This means you donâ€™t have to wait for the projector to cool down before turning it off.

full_description:
Optoma UHD35+ 4000 Lumens 4K UHD Gaming And Home Entertainment Projector

Optoma UHD35+ 4000 Lumens 4K Gaming And Home Entertainment Projector designed with DLP display with Ultra HD 3840 x 2160 resolution which can generate up to 4000 lumens brightness. The contrast ratio 1,200,000:1 is provides you the smooth watching experience. It has HDMI, VGA, USB, Audio connectivity. Optoma UHD35+ Gaming Projector designed with Lamp light source which has up to 4000 hours normal and 10000 hours economic and 15000 hours dynamic durablity.

Optoma actual 4K UHD Display

Optoma UHD35+ True 4K UHD projector is powered by a revolutionary Texas Instruments 4K UHD DLP Chipset featuring a high performance DMD utilizing XPR video processing technology with fast switching to display 8.3 million pixels (4x the number of pixels of 1080P) as mandated by the Consumer Technology Association’s 4K UHD specification. The Optoma 4K UHD projectors deliver accurate, razor sharp, high quality images by leveraging its DLP 4K UHD chip and XPR technology.

HDR / HLG Picture Mode

UHD35+ supports HDR10 and HLG. When a HDR/HLG signal is imported, the projector automatically switches to HDR / HLG display mode. Through Optoma’s HDR color mapping and tone mapping technology, it enables HDR / HLG movies or games to be presented with optimized performance in the accurate color and dynamic contrast. HDR, High Dynamic Range, is a standard that comes with a higher dynamic range in video signals, allowing the image to be shown with more brightness and color without losing any details. UHD35+ allows users to adjust the dynamic range according to the video content or environment.

Lightning-fast 240Hz Refresh Rate

Optoma UHD35+ Gaming Projector has 240Hz that 240 times per second your display device updates with new images. The higher the refresh rate, the more frames your monitor can display in each second and the smoother your on-screen image can be shown. When you turn on the Enhanced Gaming mode in UHD35+ projector, the image output will run in 1080P with 240Hz refresh rate, which is 4 times higher than standard PC gaming monitor.

Display Mode for Gaming

Optoma UHD35+ projector offers color Lab that simulations were carried out for gaming in different ambient light settings to calibrate and boost the details in the dark and develop the exclusive Game display mode where gamers can avoid getting stuck at a certain level, as they can clearly find the gimmick hidden in the dark.

HDR Effect Display Mode

UHD35+ immediately converts to HDR display mode for the best HDR visuals if the game's content supports the HDR format. In that case, UHD35+ has a HDR Sim display mode to produce HDR-effect images with the widest color range and finest contrast without compromising any detail.

full_description:
Optoma CinemaX D2 3000 Lumens 4K Ultra Short Throw DLP Laser Projector

The Optoma CinemaX D2 is a sleek ultra-short throw projector that provides an outstanding 4K UHD visual experience at home. The D2 is ideal for replicating the big-screen experience at home since it has a wide color gamut, great brightness, and superior DuraCore laser technology. With its enhanced gaming mode, the Optoma CinemaX D2 3000 Lumens 4K Ultra Short Throw DLP Laser Projector offers gamers low latency and blur-free images with a response time of 16 ms in 4K at 60Hz and 4 ms in 1080P at 240Hz, giving them a competitive edge over other projectors. The CinemaX's DuraCore laser light source produces brilliant, true color with a broad Rec.709 color gamut and a steady 3000-lumen brightness that is suitable for dimly lit to moderately lighted spaces. With its capacity to project a 100" image from less than one foot away and its flexibility to be adjusted to better match the color of your wall, the CinemaX is incredibly straightforward to set up. I occasionally saw rainbows when watching the video, which is a typical occurrence and cause for concern with DLP projectors.

True 4K UHD Visual Experience

With its 4K UHD resolution and support for eARC audio, the Optoma CinemaX D2 Ultra Short Throw Laser Projector offers a cinematic experience unlike any other. With the help of the extreme short-throw technology, you can view a 120-inch display from a mere few inches away. Up to 240Hz refresh rate at 1080P and 60Hz refresh rate at 4K UHD are supported in the enhanced gaming mode. Input lag is incredibly minimal, at only 4ms. CinemaX D2 sets up rapidly in almost any space thanks to its features, which include digital zoom, warping at 3*3 matrix, 4-corner adjustment, and 2D keystone correction. True 4K UHD resolution, HDR10 compatibility, pure glass optics, a laser light source, PureMotion picture processing, and superior sound come together in a slim form factor to produce an instant movie experience wherever.

4ms 240Hz Low Lag Gaming Mode

Experience 4K playback with the Optoma CinemaX D2 4K Ultra Short Throw DLP Laser Projector to get the best possible resolution from your games with a consistent 60 Hz frame rate and a low 16 ms latency. You can choose 1080p resolution at an incredibly fast 240 Hz refresh rate with a 4 ms low reaction time if speed and lag are your top concerns. The six-segment color wheel allows you to see brighter, more vibrant colors. The RGB color wheel reproduces games, TV shows, and movies in your home in the exact way that the filmmaker intended.

Full 3D Exprience

Support for 3D is another feature that the CinemaX D2 offers, which is a nice touch considering that projection is essentially the final frontier for 3D and is gradually becoming less common in projector features. Therefore, I'm happy to see it supported in new models wherever possible. The projector automatically enters 3D mode, which increases brightness, when it receives a 3D signal. When a regular set of 3D DLP-Link glasses linked immediately, there was very little to no crosstalk and a good sensation of depth in the image. Nine specific SDR, two 3D, and two HDR picture modes are available once this is unlocked. Cinema, Film, HDR SIM, Game, Reference, Bright, User, ISF Day, and ISF Night are among the SDR picture modes.

Easy Color Adjustments

The wide color gamut support's amazing color will elevate cinematic visuals to new heights. Vibrant, accurate, and lifelike colors are made possible with support for the large DCI-P3 color space. Make the most of your viewing environment by fine-tuning the Optoma CinemaX D2 Ultra Short Throw Laser Projector's color settings to display true and lifelike colors. By using the integrated geometric correction tool to alter individual points, you may achieve a picture that is precisely rectangular even on uneven surfaces.

Up to 120-inch Ultra Short Throw Projection

With a light source life of up to 30,000 hours, the Ultra Short Throw Laser technology produces exceptional brightness and retains breathtaking image quality over time. Any time of day, in a variety of settings, lights-on viewing for entertainment is made possible by the 3,000 lumens of brightness. With its ultra-short throw design and space-saving capabilities, the Optoma CinemaX D2 Ultra Short Throw Laser Projector offers ideal positioning for a large screen experience up to 120 inches from just inches away.
